intro: Mesostemma, commonly known as the white sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Verbenaceae and is characterized by its delicate, white or pale purple flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are narrow and often covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss. Mesostemma is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes.
